attributes.action: Introduce compensation or free crossings for delays at the Dartford Crossing.
attributes.additional_details: The Dartford Crossing is essential for travel, yet drivers frequently endure delays while paying significant fees. Lane closures and poor traffic management exacerbate these issues, causing frustration and financial strain. Compensation or free crossings for delays would promote fairness and ensure accountability, incentivizing improvements in service reliability. This policy would address public dissatisfaction and ensure paying users receive the service they deserve.
attributes.background: The Government should require compensation or free crossings for drivers experiencing delays at the Dartford Crossing. Regulations should also ensure better accountability for lane closures and improved traffic management to provide a fair and reliable service for all users.

rejection.details:
We can’t accept petitions that request action at a local level. 

You could ask your MP to take action on your concerns about this issue, including by asking them to present a public (paper) petition about this. 

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP 

And you can find out how to ask your MP to present a public (paper) petition here: https://www.parliament.uk/get-involved/sign-a-petition/paper-petitions/ 

You could also raise this issue with the Government department responsible, you can find contact details for the Department for Transport here: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-transport
